title: The Nolans - Live - I'm In The Mood

PARTY time at ManchesterÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Apollo Theatre as The newly reformed Nolans performed a faultless set. 

With an enthusiastic audience containing a fair smattering of celebrities such as Beverly Callard (CorrieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Liz McDonald), Gaynor Faye and Kerry Katona, the four sisters delivered Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and then some. 

They performed most of their new album that contains their hits and some disco and diva anthems. 

Ã¢â‚¬ËœHolding Out For A HeroÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ started us off and gave the crowd their first view of the all-male dance troupe (well it was billed as The Ultimate GirlÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Night Out). 

Ã¢â‚¬ËœItÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Raining MenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ came next Ã¢â‚¬â€œ and the hit songs continued. 

The girls had a few costume changes, and by the end they were in the figure-hugging lycra. The first change came after the sixth song; one of the highlights of the show too, the Coleen-led Ã¢â‚¬ËœEternal FlameÃ¢â‚¬â„¢. 

Halfway through, each sister had a solo spot, Coleen first, whose Ã¢â‚¬ËœLoose WomenÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ colleague Denise Welch was also in attendance. 

Then Maureen did a cracking version of Amy WinehouseÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s Ã¢â‚¬ËœValerieÃ¢â‚¬â„¢, Linda sand Ã¢â‚¬ËœMercyÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ with emotion and Bernie rocked the joint being every inch a rock- chick. 

The girls have certainly improved their stagecraft over the years and they are now seasoned pros; but not so high and mighty as to refuse a young fan a photo. They even invited her onstage to have the picture taken

Ã¢â‚¬â€œ a gesture that went down well with the audience. 

The excellent party night ended with a rousing version of Ã¢â‚¬ËœI Will SurviveÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ and everyone was on their feet, dancing and singing to Ã¢â‚¬ËœIÃ¢â‚¬â„¢m In The Mood For DancingÃ¢â‚¬â„¢. 

The show had everything: glitz, glamour, fun, and four gorgeous female singers called Nolan. 

What more could you ask for?
